meanings.definition: Obtain (goods or a service) from an outside or foreign supplier, especially in place of an internal source.
meanings.sent1: The company insourced the raw materials from a local supplier.
meanings.sent2: We insourced the printing services to save costs.
meanings.sent3: The team insourced the coffee for the meeting from a nearby cafe.
meanings.sent4: She insourced the inspiration for her painting from nature.
meanings.sent5: Insourcing the ingredients made the dish taste authentic.

meanings.definition: Assign (work) to an employee of one's company as opposed to outsourcing it to a third party.
meanings.sent1: The manager insourced the project to the in-house team.
meanings.sent2: They insourced the customer support tasks to their own staff.
meanings.sent3: Insourcing the task to Bob brought unexpected creativity to the project.
meanings.sent4: She insourced the responsibility to her most reliable colleague.
meanings.sent5: Insourcing the job ensured better quality control.
